(Simplified: 缬)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 頡 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 頡 [ jié ] contest; to fly, to soar
①有花紋的紡織品。
②眼花時所見的星星點點。
纈氨酸 [ xié ān suān ]: valine (Val), an essential amino acid
纈草 [ xié cǎo ]: valerian (Valeriana officinalis)

纈字的基本解释

纈
xiè
见“缬”。

纈字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xié］
［《廣韻》胡結切，入屑，匣。］
“缬1”的繁体字。
(1)染有彩文的丝织品。
(2)后又因所染图形不同而有各色名称，如“醉眼纈”，亦称“醉纈”。
(3)用以比喻色彩斑斓之物。
(4)眼发花时出现在眼前的星星点点。多用于形容醉眼。
(5)两颊红晕。
(6)泛指一般红晕。
(7)缬草。
(8)见“纈纈”。

纈字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　纈； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页942第31
【廣韻】【正韻】胡結切【集韻】【韻會】奚結切，?音擷。【說文】結也。【玉篇】綵纈也。【類篇】繫也，謂繫繒染爲文也。【李賀詩】醉纈拋紅網。【杜牧之詩】花塢團宮纈。

Valerian
Basic explanation of words
Valerian
xiè
See "valerian".
Valerian
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xié］
["Guang Yun" Hu knot cutting, cutting into chips, box. ]
Traditional characters for "Valley 1".
(1) Silk fabrics dyed with colored text.
(2) Later, because of the different graphics dyed, there are various names, such as "drunk eye valerian", also known as "drunk valerian".
(3) It is used as a metaphor for colorful things.
(4) The stars appearing in front of the eyes when the eyes are dazzled. Mostly used to describe drunken eyes.
(5) The cheeks are flushed.
(6) Refers to general flushing.
(7) Valerian.
(8) See "valerian".
